events.title: Assassination of President Abraham Lincoln
events.description: President Abraham Lincoln was shot by John Wilkes Booth at Ford's Theatre in Washington, D.C.
events.significance: Marked the first assassination of a U.S. president and had a profound impact on the nation during the Reconstruction era.

events.title: RMS Titanic Strikes an Iceberg
events.description: The RMS Titanic collided with an iceberg during its maiden voyage, leading to the sinking of the ship.
events.significance: Resulted in the deaths of over 1,500 passengers and crew, leading to major reforms in maritime safety regulations.

events.title: Death of Sigmund Freud
events.description: Sigmund Freud, the father of psychoanalysis, passed away in London, England.
events.significance: Marked the loss of a pioneering figure in psychology whose theories shaped modern mental health practice.

events.title: United States Bombs Libya
events.description: In retaliation for terrorist attacks, the U.S. conducted airstrikes against targets in Libya during Operation El Dorado Canyon.
events.significance: Heightened tensions during the Cold War era and drew international attention to state-sponsored terrorism.
